lead_paragraph: With polls showing that Hillary Clinton is likely to prevail in the election, liberal Democrats are beginning to exert pressure over her potential appointments.

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

headline.print_headline: Liberals Want  Warren to Push  Clinton to Left
headline.main: Liberals Hope Elizabeth Warren Will Serve as Clinton’s Scrutinizer in Chief

snippet: With polls showing that Hillary Clinton is likely to prevail in the election, liberal Democrats are beginning to exert pressure over her potential appointments....
abstract: Many liberal Democrats are hoping Sen Elizabeth Warren will work to pull Hillary Clinton to left if she wins presidency, which is looking increasingly likely in light of early voting data; political left hopes to influence staffing choices for possible Clinton administration, and have pointed to Warren's success in block political appointments in past as model.
